CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 10;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . At the material time he was a journalist at the newspaper ORG in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the local elections , the newspaper ORG published an article by the applicant accusing ORG , the newly elected mayor of PERSON , of having collaborated with the PERSON ( the intelligence service during the NORP period ) . The article , featured on the third page of the newspaper , was announced on the front page by the headline : “ Mayor with file ” ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of the article read as follows :
“ ORG ' safety above ORG security
The newly elected mayor , [ A.V.I. ] , is suspected of having collaborated with the ORG

The first scandal concerning the ORG files is about to burst in the town of PERSON . The elected mayor , [ A.V.I. ] is suspected by some citizens – whose names will not be made public for obvious reasons – of having collaborated with the ORG . Based on information from inside ORG , our sources said that [ A.V.I. ] was under surveillance until DATE as an irredentist chauvinist , which made it impossible for him to obtain a history teaching post in PERSON ... During the same period [ A.V.I. ] was allegedly persuaded to collaborate with the ORG , and a file allegedly exists on this matter ...

Before the local elections , [ A.V.I. ] lodged a written statement with ORG ... declaring that he had not been part of the former ORG . He informed us DATE that what he had written in that statement was true and that he had never collaborated in any way with the secret police before DATE . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE A.V.I. lodged a criminal complaint for insult and defamation against the applicant with ORG . His complaint also included the company which published the newspaper .
CARDINAL . ORG heard testimonies from CARDINAL witnesses who confirmed that they had told the applicant about the rumours concerning the victim 's collaboration with the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant gave a statement to the court . He pleaded not guilty and relied in his defence on the right to freedom of expression and the right to provide information about public figures .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave judgment in the case . It considered that the applicant had not committed defamation , as he had not referred to any specific offences allegedly committed by the victim . It found that the expressions used by the applicant , including the headline on the front page , were manifestly insulting to the victim . However , ORG noted that the applicant had not described any of the rumours as fact and that he had also presented the victim 's point of view in the article .

It further considered that a certain degree of aggressiveness was common in journalism and that therefore , although the facts met the legal criteria to constitute the and their consequences were not severe enough to come within the sphere of criminal law .

ORG acquitted the applicant of both defamation and insult and imposed an administrative fine of CARDINAL NORP lei ( ROL ) . The court also found that the conditions had been met for the applicant 's civil liability and that of the company publishing the newspaper , in respect of the prejudice caused to the victim . It thus ordered the applicant and the company to pay ORG to A.V.I. as compensation for non - pecuniary damage . Lastly , the applicant was ordered to pay ROL CARDINAL to the ORG in court fees .

CARDINAL . All parties appealed . The victim contested the acquittal and sought to have the amount of damages increased . The company publishing the newspaper argued that the prejudice had not been proven by the victim . The applicant claimed that the legal requirements had not been fulfilled either for the existence of the offence of defamation or for the existence of insult .

CARDINAL . On DATE the parties ' representatives presented the grounds for appeal orally before ORG . The applicant was invited to speak only before the end of the hearing ( ultimul cuvânt al inculpatului ) . In his address he requested that ORG 's appeal be dismissed .

CARDINAL . The final decision was adopted on DATE . ORG allowed the appeal lodged by A.V.I. It acquiesced in the statement of facts established by ORG but considered that the first - instance court had failed to interpret them correctly . It found that the expressions used by the applicant , in particular , “ the mayor is suspected of having collaborated with the ORG ” , “ was allegedly persuaded to collaborate with the ORG , and a file allegedly exists on this matter ” and “ was under surveillance as an irredentist chauvinist ” , were manifestly defamatory and , if true , would expose the victim to public opprobrium at the least . It considered that the applicant 's intention to denigrate was proved and that he was not therefore covered by LAW and the Convention , which guaranteed the right to freedom of expression only when it was exercised in good faith . However , for and their consequences were not severe enough to come within the sphere of criminal law . It therefore acquitted the applicant on both accounts and imposed on him an administrative fine of ROL CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . The court also considered that the prejudice incurred by the victim had not been correctly evaluated by ORG and increased the amount to be paid by the applicant and the newspaper company to ORG . It awarded ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL for costs , to be paid jointly by the applicant and the company . Lastly , the court ordered the applicant to pay ROL MONEY to the State for court fees .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant paid the administrative fine .

CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of ORG concerning insult and defamation and liability for paying damages in force at the material time are described in PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE .
CARDINAL . LAW has been amended repeatedly and in DATE the ORG on insult and defamation were repealed ( for details , see PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
CARDINAL . NORP However , in decision no . CARDINAL of DATE ORG declared unconstitutional the removal from LAW of the ORG concerning insult and defamation .

CARDINAL . Law no . CARDINAL amended LAW and made it mandatory for an appeal court to hear the accused where the first - instance court had acquitted him or her . Currently , where an appeal court quashes a judgment given by a first - instance court , it must decide on the evidence to be adduced and set a date on which it will take statements from the accused if the latter was not heard or if he or she was acquitted by the first - instance court ( Articles DATE § DATE , as amended ) .
